task_summary: Robot detects the T-shaped block, moves to a pre-push pose, aligns with it, performs two forward pushes toward the fixed goal, then retreats.
assumptions: block_T and the fixed target are on a planar table
friction is sufficient for pushing without sliding the end-effector
observation and control operate at 10 Hz as stated

node_specs.description: Write a string value to a blackboard key.
Perception check that the target is currently visible.
Active search when the target is not visible.
Set end-effector yaw (useful for push orientation).
Approach the object and align contact direction.
Push the target by a straight-line displacement.
Back off to clear the workspace after pushing.

failure_modes: misalignment causes rotation of the T-block
insufficient push distance to reach the fixed goal
recovery_strategy: perform additional Push cycles if goal not reached

local_annotations.label: align at contact edge of T-block

expected_success_criteria: block_T translated along push direction toward the fixed goal without undesired rotation
